name: overthrow

overthrow verb
(DEFEAT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ T ] uk
Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/ˌəʊ.vəˈθrəʊ/ us
Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/ˌoʊ.vɚˈθroʊ/ to defeat or remove someone from power, using force: He said that Allende's government in Chile was overthrown by the army and the CIA in 1973.

overthrow verb
(THROW)
[ I or T ] US uk
Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/ˈəʊ.və.θrəʊ/ us
Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/ˈoʊ.vɚ.θroʊ/ uk/ˌəʊ.vəˈθrəʊ/ to throw a ball past the person or object you intended to throw to: The quarterback overthrew (the pass).

overthrow noun
(DEFEAT)
[ C usually singular ] an occasion when someone or something is removed from power using force: the overthrow of the monarchy

overthrow noun
(THROW)
[ C usually singular ] the act of throwing a ball too far
[ C ] a score in cricket made when the ball is thrown past the person it was intended to be thrown to
